verses.kjv: It came to pass after this also, that the children of Moab, and the children of Ammon, and with them other beside the Ammonites, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.
verses.web: After this, the children of Moab, the children of Ammon, and with them some of the Ammonites, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.
verses.ct: Some time later, the armies of Moab and Ammon, along with some of the Meunites, came to wage war against Jehoshaphat.

verses.kjv: Then there came some that told Jehoshaphat, saying, There cometh a great multitude against thee from beyond the sea on this side Syria; and, behold, they be in Hazazontamar, which is Engedi.
verses.web: Then some came who told Jehoshaphat, saying, “A great multitude is coming against you from beyond the sea from Syria. Behold, they are in Hazazon Tamar” (that is, En Gedi).
verses.ct: Messengers arrived and told Jehoshaphat, "A massive army is coming against you from across the Dead Sea, from the direction of Syria. They've already reached Hazazontamar" — that is, Engedi.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek the LORD, and proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat was alarmed, and set himself to seek to LORD. He proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat was terrified. He committed himself to seeking the LORD and proclaimed a fast throughout all of Judah.

verses.kjv: And Judah gathered themselves together, to ask help of the LORD: even out of all the cities of Judah they came to seek the LORD.
verses.web: Judah gathered themselves together to seek help from LORD. They came out of all the cities of Judah to seek LORD.
verses.ct: People from every city in Judah gathered together to ask the LORD for help.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of the LORD, before the new court,
verses.web: Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem, in LORD’s house, before the new court;
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat stood before the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem in the LORD's temple, in front of the new courtyard,

verses.kjv: And said, O LORD God of our fathers, art not thou God in heaven? and rulest not thou over all the kingdoms of the heathen? and in thine hand is there not power and might, so that none is able to withstand thee?
verses.web: and he said, “LORD, the God of our fathers, aren’t you God in heaven? Aren’t you ruler over all the kingdoms of the nations? Power and might are in your hand, so that no one is able to withstand you.
verses.ct: and he prayed: "LORD, God of our fathers — aren't you the God who rules from heaven? Don't you have authority over every kingdom on earth? Power and might are in your hand, and no one can stand against you.

verses.kjv: Art not thou our God, who didst drive out the inhabitants of this land before thy people Israel, and gavest it to the seed of Abraham thy friend for ever?
verses.web: Didn’t you, our God, drive out the inhabitants of this land before your people Israel, and give it to the offspring of Abraham your friend forever?
verses.ct: Aren't you our God, who drove out the people living in this land to make room for your people Israel? You gave this land forever to the descendants of Abraham, your friend.

verses.kjv: And they dwelt therein, and have built thee a sanctuary therein for thy name, saying,
verses.web: They lived in it, and have built you a sanctuary in it for your name, saying,
verses.ct: They settled here and built a sanctuary for your name, saying,

verses.kjv: If, when evil cometh upon us, as the sword, judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we stand before this house, and in thy presence, (for thy name is in this house,) and cry unto thee in our affliction, then thou wilt hear and help.
verses.web: ‘If evil comes on us—the sword, judgment, pestilence, or famine—we will stand before this house, and before you (for your name is in this house), and cry to you in our affliction, and you will hear and save.’
verses.ct: 'If disaster strikes us — whether war, judgment, plague, or famine — we will stand before this temple and before you, since your name dwells in this house. We will cry out to you in our distress, and you will hear us and rescue us.'

verses.kjv: And now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab and mount Seir, whom thou wouldest not let Israel invade, when they came out of the land of Egypt, but they turned from them, and destroyed them not;
verses.web: Now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab and Mount Seir, whom you would not let Israel invade when they came out of the land of Egypt, but they turned away from them, and didn’t destroy them;
verses.ct: Now look — the armies of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir are attacking us. These are the very nations you wouldn't let Israel invade when they came out of Egypt. Our ancestors turned away from them and didn't destroy them.

verses.kjv: Behold, I say, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of thy possession, which thou hast given us to inherit.
verses.web: behold, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of your possession, which you have given us to inherit.
verses.ct: And this is how they repay us — by coming to throw us out of the land you gave us as an inheritance!

verses.kjv: O our God, wilt thou not judge them? for we have no might against this great company that cometh against us; neither know we what to do: but our eyes are upon thee.
verses.web: Our God, will you not judge them? For we have no might against this great company that comes against us. We don’t know what to do, but our eyes are on you.”
verses.ct: Our God, won't you bring judgment on them? We don't have the strength to face this enormous army marching against us. We don't know what to do, but our eyes are on you."

verses.kjv: And all Judah stood before the LORD, with their little ones, their wives, and their children.
verses.web: All Judah stood before LORD, with their little ones, their wives, and their children.
verses.ct: All of Judah stood before the LORD — men, women, and children, even the little ones.

verses.kjv: Then upon Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, a Levite of the sons of Asaph, came the Spirit of the LORD in the midst of the congregation;
verses.web: Then LORD’s Spirit came on Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, the Levite, of the sons of Asaph, in the middle of the assembly;
verses.ct: Then the spirit of the LORD came upon Jahaziel son of Zechariah, son of Benaiah, son of Jeiel, son of Mattaniah — a Levite descended from Asaph — right there in the middle of the assembly.

verses.kjv: And he said, Hearken ye, all Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem, and thou king Jehoshaphat, Thus saith the LORD unto you, Be not afraid nor dismayed by reason of this great multitude; for the battle is not yours, but God’s.
verses.web: and he said, “Listen, all Judah, and you inhabitants of Jerusalem, and you, king Jehoshaphat. LORD says to you, ‘Don’t be afraid, and don’t be dismayed because of this great multitude; for the battle is not yours, but God’s.
verses.ct: He declared, "Listen carefully, all of Judah and everyone living in Jerusalem — and you, King Jehoshaphat! This is what the LORD says to you: 'Don't be afraid or discouraged by this massive army. This battle isn't yours — it's God's.

verses.kjv: To morrow go ye down against them: behold, they come up by the cliff of Ziz; and ye shall find them at the end of the brook, before the wilderness of Jeruel.
verses.web: Tomorrow, go down against them. Behold, they are coming up by the ascent of Ziz. You will find them at the end of the valley, before the wilderness of Jeruel.
verses.ct: Tomorrow, march down against them. They'll be coming up through the pass of Ziz, and you'll find them at the end of the valley, just before the wilderness of Jeruel.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not need to fight in this battle: set yourselves, stand ye still, and see the salvation of the LORD with you, O Judah and Jerusalem: fear not, nor be dismayed; to morrow go out against them: for the LORD will be with you.
verses.web: You will not need to fight this battle. Set yourselves, stand still, and see the salvation of LORD with you, O Judah and Jerusalem. Don’t be afraid, nor be dismayed. Go out against them tomorrow, for LORD is with you.’ ”
verses.ct: You won't even need to fight this battle. Take your positions, stand firm, and watch the LORD deliver you. Judah and Jerusalem, don't be afraid or lose heart. Go out and face them tomorrow, because the LORD will be with you.'"

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground: and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell before the LORD, worshipping the LORD.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground; and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell down before LORD, worshiping LORD.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat bowed with his face to the ground, and everyone in Judah and Jerusalem fell down before the LORD and worshiped him.

verses.kjv: And the Levites, of the children of the Kohathites, and of the children of the Korhites, stood up to praise the LORD God of Israel with a loud voice on high.
verses.web: The Levites, of the children of the Kohathites and of the children of the Korahites, stood up to praise LORD, the God of Israel, with an exceedingly loud voice.
verses.ct: Then the Levites from the families of Kohath and Korah stood up and praised the LORD, the God of Israel, with voices so loud they echoed through the temple.

verses.kjv: And they rose early in the morning, and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, Hear me, O Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem; Believe in the LORD your God, so shall ye be established; believe his prophets, so shall ye prosper.
verses.web: They rose early in the morning, and went out into the wilderness of Tekoa. As they went out, Jehoshaphat stood and said, “Listen to me, Judah, and you inhabitants of Jerusalem! Believe in LORD your God, so you will be established! Believe his prophets, so you will prosper.”
verses.ct: Early the next morning, they headed out toward the wilderness of Tekoa. As they set out, Jehoshaphat stood and called out, "Listen to me, Judah and people of Jerusalem! Believe in the LORD your God, and you will stand firm. Believe his prophets, and you will succeed."

verses.kjv: And when he had consulted with the people, he appointed singers unto the LORD, and that should praise the beauty of holiness, as they went out before the army, and to say, Praise the LORD; for his mercy endureth for ever.
verses.web: When he had taken counsel with the people, he appointed those who were to sing to LORD, and give praise in holy array, as they go out before the army, and say, “Give thanks to LORD; for his loving kindness endures forever.”
verses.ct: After consulting with the people, he appointed singers to walk ahead of the army, praising the LORD in holy splendor and singing, "Give thanks to the LORD, for his mercy endures forever."

verses.kjv: And when they began to sing and to praise, the LORD set ambushments against the children of Ammon, Moab, and mount Seir, which were come against Judah; and they were smitten.
verses.web: When they began to sing and to praise, LORD set ambushers against the children of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, who had come against Judah; and they were struck.
verses.ct: The moment they began singing and praising, the LORD threw the armies of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir into confusion, and they turned on each other.

verses.kjv: For the children of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of mount Seir, utterly to slay and destroy them: and when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir, every one helped to destroy another.
verses.web: For the children of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of Mount Seir to utterly kill and destroy them. When they had finished the inhabitants of Seir, everyone helped to destroy each other.
verses.ct: The Ammonites and Moabites attacked the men from Mount Seir first, completely destroying them. Then, once Seir's forces were wiped out, they turned on each other.

verses.kjv: And when Judah came toward the watch tower in the wilderness, they looked unto the multitude, and, behold, they were dead bodies fallen to the earth, and none escaped.
verses.web: When Judah came to the place overlooking the wilderness, they looked at the multitude; and behold, they were dead bodies fallen to the earth, and there were none who escaped.
verses.ct: When the men of Judah reached the lookout point overlooking the wilderness, they gazed out at the enemy army — and all they saw were dead bodies scattered across the ground. Not a single one had escaped.

verses.kjv: And when Jehoshaphat and his people came to take away the spoil of them, they found among them in abundance both riches with the dead bodies, and precious jewels, which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away: and they were three days in gathering of the spoil, it was so much.
verses.web: When Jehoshaphat and his people came to take their plunder, they found among them in abundance both riches and dead bodies, and precious jewels, which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away. They took plunder for three days, it was so much.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat and his people went down to collect the plunder and found an enormous amount of goods — equipment, clothing, and precious jewels — more than they could carry. It took them 3 days just to gather it all.

verses.kjv: And on the fourth day they assembled themselves in the valley of Berachah; for there they blessed the LORD: therefore the name of the same place was called, The valley of Berachah, unto this day.
verses.web: On the fourth day, they assembled themselves in Beracah Valley, for there they blessed LORD. Therefore the name of that place was called “Beracah Valley” to this day.
verses.ct: On the 4th day, they assembled in the Valley of Berachah, where they praised the LORD. That's why the place is still called the Valley of Berachah to this day.

verses.kjv: Then they returned, every man of Judah and Jerusalem, and Jehoshaphat in the forefront of them, to go again to Jerusalem with joy; for the LORD had made them to rejoice over their enemies.
verses.web: Then they returned, every man of Judah and Jerusalem, with Jehoshaphat in front of them, to go again to Jerusalem with joy; for LORD had made them to rejoice over their enemies.
verses.ct: Then every man of Judah and Jerusalem marched back home with Jehoshaphat leading the way, filled with joy because the LORD had given them victory over their enemies.

verses.kjv: And they came to Jerusalem with psalteries and harps and trumpets unto the house of the LORD.
verses.web: They came to Jerusalem with stringed instruments, harps, and trumpets to LORD’s house.
verses.ct: They entered Jerusalem with harps, lyres, and trumpets and went straight to the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And the fear of God was on all the kingdoms of those countries, when they had heard that the LORD fought against the enemies of Israel.
verses.web: The fear of God was on all the kingdoms of the countries, when they heard that LORD fought against the enemies of Israel.
verses.ct: When the surrounding kingdoms heard that the LORD himself had fought against Israel's enemies, the fear of God fell on all of them.

verses.kjv: So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet: for his God gave him rest round about.
verses.web: So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet, for his God gave him rest all around.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat's kingdom enjoyed peace, because his God gave him rest on every side.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah: he was thirty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was 35 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 25 years. His mother's name was Azubah daughter of Shilhi.

verses.kjv: And he walked in the way of Asa his father, and departed not from it, doing that which was right in the sight of the LORD.
verses.web: He walked in the way of Asa his father, and didn’t turn away from it, doing that which was right in LORD’s eyes.
verses.ct: He followed the example of his father Asa and never strayed from it. The LORD was pleased with what he did.

verses.kjv: Howbeit the high places were not taken away: for as yet the people had not prepared their hearts unto the God of their fathers.
verses.web: However the high places were not taken away, and the people had still not set their hearts on the God of their fathers.
verses.ct: However, the high places were not removed, because the people still hadn't fully devoted their hearts to the God of their fathers.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Jehu the son of Hanani, who is mentioned in the book of the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Jehu the son of Hanani, which is included in the book of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about Jehoshaphat's reign, from beginning to end, is recorded in the writings of Jehu son of Hanani, which are included in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: And after this did Jehoshaphat king of Judah join himself with Ahaziah king of Israel, who did very wickedly:
verses.web: After this, Jehoshaphat king of Judah joined himself with Ahaziah king of Israel. The same did very wickedly.
verses.ct: Later, King Jehoshaphat of Judah made an alliance with King Ahaziah of Israel, who was deeply wicked.

verses.kjv: And he joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish: and they made the ships in Eziongaber.
verses.web: He joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish. They made the ships in Ezion Geber.
verses.ct: Together they built ships at Eziongaber, intending to sail to Tarshish.

verses.kjv: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavah of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, Because thou hast joined thyself with Ahaziah, the LORD hath broken thy works. And the ships were broken, that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
verses.web: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, “Because you have joined yourself with Ahaziah, LORD has destroyed your works.” The ships were wrecked, so that they were not able to go to Tarshish.
verses.ct: But Eliezer son of Dodavah from Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, "Because you made an alliance with Ahaziah, the LORD has destroyed what you built." The ships were wrecked and never made it to Tarshish.
